p: In the 4000 to 2500 cm −1 region, the spectra show absorption bands at 3296 cm −1, which correspond to the −OH stretch formed with hydroxyl groups of starch and glycerol [ 66, 73] and between 2918 and 2926 cm −1, attributed to the absorption of alkanes due to the stretching of C–H [ 75]. While in the region from 2000 to 1500 cm −1, absorption bands were observed between 1642 and 1648 cm −1, which corresponds to the angular deformation of −OH bonds [ 74]. A small peak at 1553 cm −1 was observed only in the film with microencapsulated oil ( Figure 5c), characteristic of the amino group [ 66]. This peak can be related to the microparticle covering material, since Dammak et al. [ 62] reported that gelatin films showed an amino band at 1537 cm −1.
